intro: Arrabidaea weberbaueri, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
